Comments_List: This was a great introductory course on quantitative methods.  I came away from this course with a good understanding of research design methods and strategies for optimal design.
Building research questions in  way that eventually lead to intervention development. How different research designs are used to answer different types of questions about a topic.

The course provided rich content.  The supplemental readings were helpful to elaborate on points made in the text book.
I might suggest moving the slide presentations to the first half of the class and follow with class discussion (rather than discussion coming first).

Yes-great foundational course.
The annotated bibliography assignment was very helpful in beginning to learn how to critique manuscripts and thoughtfully synthesize content.
Yes. It formed a foundation for understanding and designing quantitative research.
